metadata.synopsis: Voss arrives at camp and attempts to sway Laezel to his side after the events of the Creche.
metadata.how_to_trigger: - loadlevel SCL_Main_A- using the Camp Debug Book (CTRL + SHIFT + 8), queue NIGHT_Laezel_VossCampConfrontation- with Laezel as an Avatar, do a long rest

44.context: CinematicNodeContext: The player wakes up in the middle of the night to find Kith'rak Voss there, accompanied by one other gith. Voss holds his sword in a seemingle aggressive manner.

27.speaker: Kith'rak Voss
27.text: Child of Gith. Or should I say - Hshar'lak?

82.speaker: Lae'zel
82.text: Supreme Kith'rak. Has Vlaakith sent you to slay me with your own blade?

25.speaker: Kith'rak Voss
25.text: I've not come to kill you, Lae'zel. I've come to aid you.
25.context: NodeContext: Voss should not be menacing here. Turns out he's a good guy. And he should be very charismatic all through this dialogue.

5.speaker: Kith'rak Voss
5.text: I've not come to kill you, child. I've come to aid you.
5.context: NodeContext: Voss should not be menacing here. Turns out he's a good guy. And he should be very charismatic all through this dialogue.

32.text: He's trying to corrupt you with lies - we need to get rid of him.

75.context: CinematicNodeContext: [SCENE] Voss kneels and lays his sword on the ground in the githyanki sign of submission.

2.speaker: Kith'rak Voss
2.text: Ska'kek kir Gith shabell'eth. My blade rests. Mother Gith compels you to listen.
2.context: NodeContext: Addressed to Lae'zel. SKA-kek keer gith shah-BELL-eth. 'The word of Gith be present'.

73.speaker: Lae'zel
73.text: Your cronies tried to kill us. Why should I listen to you?

47.speaker: Kith'rak Voss
47.text: I knew you would fight - and I knew you would win. I needed to ensure Vlaakith's trust. This was the only way.

63.speaker: Kith'rak Voss
63.text: I know you carry the Astral Prism, Lae'zel.

71.speaker: Lae'zel
71.text: Fine. I'll hear what you have to say before I gut you.

50.speaker: Kith'rak Voss
50.text: Be at ease. I bring only truth.

68.speaker: Lae'zel
68.text: Speak. You have my ear, as Mother Gith taught us.

13.speaker: Lae'zel
13.text: My own queen hunts me. Why in the hells should I listen to you?

62.speaker: Kith'rak Voss
62.text: I am no servant of Queen Vlaakith. But I know who you are, and I know of the Astral Prism you carry.

74.speaker: Kith'rak Voss
74.text: Within it lies the seed of Vlaakith's demise. And I intend to help you bring it to fruition.

4.speaker: Lae'zel
4.text: Who is this 'seed of Vlaakith's demise'?

21.speaker: Kith'rak Voss
21.text: But the one inside's chosen you as an ally, protects you with their power.

53.speaker: Kith'rak Voss
53.text: That very power will be the end of Vlaakith's tyranny. The Prism's tenant must be let loose.

28.speaker: Lae'zel
28.text: What are you asking of me, Voss?

80.speaker: Kith'rak Voss
80.text: I'm asking for your help - and your trust.

30.speaker: Lae'zel
30.text: A kith'rak resists the Undying Queen? That either makes you a fool - or a hero.

57.speaker: Kith'rak Voss
57.text: A fool stumbles without cause. A hero serves a cause without question.

7.speaker: Kith'rak Voss
7.text: I am neither. 'Clear of heart, clear of mind, and bound by no master.' Now - you must listen.

79.speaker: Kith'rak Voss
79.text: The Prism's tenant can put an end to Vlaakith's tyranny. They must be let loose.

17.speaker: Lae'zel
17.text: I'm not giving you the Astral Prism, if that's what you're wanting.

8.speaker: Kith'rak Voss
8.text: I've heard word from Crèche Y'llek. You are infected - yet the one in the Prism has chosen you, protects you with their power.

56.speaker: Kith'rak Voss
56.text: The Prism's tenant alone has the power to end Vlaakith's tyranny. They must be let loose.

15.speaker: Kith'rak Voss
15.text: I've sought their freedom for aeons. When the Prism went missing, I feared the worst.

66.speaker: Kith'rak Voss
66.text: Instead, you've granted the opportunity I've so long awaited.

18.speaker: Kith'rak Voss
18.text: All that remains is the key that unchains them - and I've found someone who I believe can provide it.

83.speaker: Kith'rak Voss
83.text: Bring the Prism to Baldur's Gate. I'll be waiting in a taproom called Sharess' Caress. That is where we decide the fate of our people.

42.speaker: Kith'rak Voss
42.text: Lae'zel - together we will break our chains, and be Vlaakith's slaves no longer.

61.speaker: Lae'zel
61.text: I am no slave. It is Vlaakith who will purify me and ascend me.
61.context: NodeContext: Thoughtful, not too vehement. zhe-STIL KITH-rack.

81.speaker: Kith'rak Voss
81.text: Lies, Lae'zel - every last one. There is no purification, no ascension.

60.speaker: Kith'rak Voss
60.text: The zaith'isk does not purify - it extracts memory and kills the infected. Nor does the lich queen glorify the ascended. She feeds on most all of them to grow her power and pursue godhood.

39.speaker: Narrator
39.text: *Ascension - the foundation of githyanki belief. Bring Queen Vlaakith an illithid's head, and she will grant you an eternal home in the great city of Tu'narath.*

48.speaker: Narrator
48.text: *This has been your life's purpose. Could Vlaakith truly intend to consume your life force to strengthen her own?*

24.speaker: Lae'zel
24.text: Who is the person inside the Prism?

29.speaker: Kith'rak Voss
29.text: If they have not said, they must have good reason. And I won't be the one to betray them.

43.speaker: Lae'zel
43.text: I'll let you leave this camp alive. But I can promise nothing more.

55.speaker: Kith'rak Voss
55.text: Take this. It is a qua'nith - a psionic detector.
55.context: CinematicNodeContext: [SCENE] Gives the psionic detectorNodeContext: QUAH-nith

9.speaker: Kith'rak Voss
9.text: The queen's warriors hunt you. The qua'nith will sound out when you come near their portals. Hear its cry, and prepare for battle - or slip away.

72.speaker: Kith'rak Voss
72.text: I should go. Vlaakith's gaze pierces the seas and skies. She believes me loyal - and I can't afford her mistrust.

38.speaker: Kith'rak Voss
38.text: Keep the Astral Prism close. Let no one take it from you. Slay any who try.

77.speaker: Kith'rak Voss
77.text: Now - to Baldur's Gate. I'll be waiting, Lae'zel.

69.context: CinematicNodeContext: [SCENE] Voss and his companions wave their hands together, and a portal opens before them. They step through and the portals close behind them.

34.speaker: Lae'zel
34.text: Your words carry truth - I will meet you in Baldur's Gate.

65.context: CinematicNodeContext: [SCENE] Voss takes his blade from the ground and rises.

51.speaker: Kith'rak Voss
51.text: Lae'zel. I see T'lak'ma Ghir in you - Sister in Freedom. Together, we will be our people's light.

10.speaker: Lae'zel
10.text: I will not abandon my queen. Die, kith'rak!

26.speaker: Kith'rak Voss
26.context: CinematicNodeContext: Voss grabs his blade from the ground and gears up to attack.NodeContext: Heh-TAH-zith - Die, creature!

19.speaker: Lae'zel
19.text: Vlaakith's demise? I should run you through for suggesting it.

14.speaker: Kith'rak Voss
14.text: Because her throne rests on lies, more than a hundred gish scholars could count in a lifetime. I will share but two.

64.speaker: Lae'zel
64.text: I've heard enough. Taste my fury, kith'rak.

40.speaker: Lae'zel
40.text: No more words. This camp will be your grave.

59.speaker: Lae'zel
59.text: A kith'rak. Has our Queen sent you to slay me yourself?

49.speaker: Kith'rak Voss
49.text: At ease, child. Jhe'stil Kith'rak does not come to kill you -
49.context: NodeContext: zhe-STILL KITH-rack. Supreme Knight. Fatherly, but not antagonsistically like before.

20.speaker: Lae'zel
20.text: I am not Hshar'lak. You must hear me - Vlaakith has abandoned us.

3.speaker: Kith'rak Voss
3.text: You make a dangerous accusation. Vlaakith would call your words heresy.

41.speaker: Lae'zel
41.text: Honoured kith'rak. Tell me you bring me Vlaakith's forgiveness.

37.speaker: Kith'rak Voss
37.text: Forgiveness? Ignorant child. In Vlaakith, there is no forgiveness. You might as well beg a dragon for its wings.

33.speaker: Kith'rak Voss
33.text: I do not bring her mercy. I bring you the truth.

67.speaker: Lae'zel
67.text: Enjoy your next breath. It will be your last.
